A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Terrible to see such disrespect to Luke and Yoda.  This movie was made by people who hate star wars\, so they work hard to deconstruct its pillars.  Yoda destroys ancient jedi texts\, Luke contemplating murder of his wayward nephew then hiding on an island while same nephew wreaks havoc on the galaxy.  Rey doesn't need a teacher\,  boys and girls\,  you know better than your elders who are a bunch of cynical cranks drinking green beast milk while working out their self hatred.  Even Finn getting saved and chastised for his attempt at self sacrifice...what is the lesson here?   No greater love. ..  well that wisdom worked for the admiral lady\, why not Finn?\n\nIt is also annoying that the entire movie keeps the rebels at the very edge of destruction.  There are times in a story for not everyone to need to be in a panic.   Seemed lazy story telling\, and did not feel rivetting in the least.   I'll quit now.
